predicate.note: Frames file for 'saturate' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 9.8.

roleset.name: fill to capacity

example.name: agent and substance merged
example.text: As hamburger and pizza outlets saturate one area after another, franchisers are struggling desperately for market share, slashing prices and stepping up costly promotions.

example.name: no substance mentioned
example.text: But low-priced and middle-priced furriers like Mr. Purnick, who [*T*-1] once saturated the five-block Seventh Avenue fur district, say imports have cut their sales.
example.arg: the five-block Seventh Avenue fur district

example.name: no agent mentioned
example.text: The day was saturated [*-1] with the weight of its own impending history.
example.arg: the weight of its own impending history

roleset.note: It is very important to distinguish the agent of filling and the substance!
